name: Straight-arm Pull Down
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing under a pull-down bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Reach up and grab the bar with both hands, keeping your arms straight and your elbows locked out.
3. Engage your core and lower back muscles to maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.
4. Slowly lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight and bracing yourself against any movement in your body.
5. Pull the bar down towards your chest, focusing on using your upper back muscles to control the movement.
6. Avoid hinging at the hips or arching your lower back as you pull the bar towards you.
7. Hold for a brief moment, then slowly return the bar to its original position over your head,
8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Straight-arm Pull Down targets the upper back muscles with a focus on control and proper posture
